record.title: ORDERS FOR THURSDAY, JULY 12, 2007
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR THURSDAY, JULY 12, 2007 -- (Senate - July 11, 2007)

[Page: S9057]

speaking.paragraph: Madam President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 9:30 a.m., tomorrow morning, July 12; that on Thursday, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, and the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day; that there then be a period of morning business for 30 minutes, with Senators permitted to speak therein, with the time equally divided and controlled between the two leaders or their designees; that at the close of morning business, the Senate resume consideration of H.R. 1585, the Department of Defense authorization bill, and then proceed to the McCain or designee amendment, as provided for under a previous order.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
